API Reference

This page provides an auto-generated summary of fllume’s public API.

class fllume.agent.Agent(model, instructions=None, tools=None, response_format=None, prompt_template=None, params=None)[source]

Bases: object

An LLM-powered agent that can complete prompts, use tools, and more.

The Agent class is the main entry point for interacting with large language models. It can be configured with specific instructions, tools, response formats, and other parameters to tailor its behavior for specific tasks.

It is recommended to create Agent instances using the fluent AgentBuilder by calling Agent.builder().

__init__(model, instructions=None, tools=None, response_format=None, prompt_template=None, params=None)[source]

Initializes the Agent.

Parameters:

  • model (str) – The identifier of the language model to use (e.g., ‘ollama/llama3’). See the any-llm documentation for a full list of providers, depending on how any-llm was installed.

  • instructions (str | None) – The system-level instructions for the agent.

  • tools (list[Callable[[...], Any]] | None) – A list of Python functions to be used as tools. Annotating each function with a docstring and type hints will help the model make effective use of them.

  • response_format (dict[str, Any] | type[BaseModel] | None) – The desired format for the response, e.g., a Pydantic model or a JSON schema.

  • prompt_template (str | None) – A template for formatting dictionary-based prompts, as a format string.

  • params (dict[str, Any] | None) – Additional parameters to pass to the LLM API.

classmethod builder()[source]

Creates a new AgentBuilder instance for fluently constructing an Agent.

Returns:

An instance of AgentBuilder.

Return type:

AgentBuilder

complete_with_context(context=None, prompt=None, stream=False)[source]

Executes a completion within a given conversational context.

This method is used for multi-turn interactions. The context returned from one call should be passed as the context argument in the next call to maintain the conversational history.

Parameters:

  • context (list[dict[str, Any]] | None) – The list of messages representing the conversation history.

  • prompt (str | dict[str, Any] | None) – The new user prompt to add to the conversation.

  • stream (bool) – If True, the response will be returned as a generator of message objects. Defaults to False.

Returns:

If streaming, a generator that yields message objects. If not streaming, the updated context list including the new user prompt and the assistant’s response.

Return type:

list[dict[str, Any]] | Generator[dict[str, Any], None, None]

complete(prompt, stream=False)[source]

Executes a prompt and returns the agent’s response.

This is the primary method for interacting with the agent. It takes a prompt, sends it to the LLM (along with any configured context, tools, etc.), and returns the final response.

Parameters:

  • prompt (str | dict[str, Any]) – The user prompt. Can be a string or a dictionary if the agent was configured with a prompt_template.

  • stream (bool) – If True, the response will be returned as a generator of string chunks. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The agent’s response, which can be a string, a Pydantic model, a dictionary, or a generator of strings if streaming.

Return type:

str | Generator[str, None, None] | BaseModel | dict[str, Any]

class fllume.agent.AgentBuilder(agent_cls)[source]

Bases: object

A fluent builder for creating and configuring Agent instances.

__init__(agent_cls)[source]

Initializes the AgentBuilder.

Parameters:

agent_cls (Type[Agent]) – The Agent class to be instantiated by the builder.

Builds and returns a configured Agent instance.

A new Agent instance with the specified configuration.

Sets the language model for the agent.

Parameters:

model (str) –

The identifier of the language model to use (e.g., “ollama/llama3”). See the any-llm documentation for a full list of providers, depending on how any-llm was installed.

Returns:

The AgentBuilder instance for chaining.

Return type:

AgentBuilder

with_instructions(instructions)[source]

Sets the system-level instructions for the agent.

Parameters:

instructions (str) – A string containing the instructions that guide the agent’s behavior.

Returns:

The AgentBuilder instance for chaining.

with_tools(tools)[source]

Provides a list of Python functions to be used as tools by the agent.

Parameters:

tools (list[Callable[[...], Any]]) – A list of callable Python functions.

Returns:

The AgentBuilder instance for chaining.

with_response_format(response_format)[source]

Specifies the desired format for the agent’s response.

Parameters:

response_format (dict[str, Any] | type[BaseModel]) – A Pydantic model or a JSON schema dictionary that defines the structure of the output.

Returns:

The AgentBuilder instance for chaining.

Return type:

AgentBuilder

with_prompt_template(template)[source]

Sets a prompt template for formatting dictionary-based prompts.

Parameters:

template (str) – A format string (e.g., “Summarize: {text}”).

Returns:

The AgentBuilder instance for chaining.

Return type:

AgentBuilder

with_params(params)[source]

Sets additional parameters to be passed to the LLM API.

Parameters:

params (dict[str, Any]) – A dictionary of parameters (e.g., {“temperature”: 0.7}).

Returns:

The AgentBuilder instance for chaining.
